chapter.title: Overview of How to Use IAM Admin
chapter.para: IAM Admin is generally structured with following five menus.

listitem.para: User Management : User and usergroup management menu
Roles Management : ROLE management menu. Resources or user, usergroup can be registered to a role.
Resource Management : Resource management menu. Register new resources or delete or can set screen control function.
Restriction Management : Menu to manage limits by time. Time limitation for user, role and resource can be managed.
System Management : Enterprise application management menu. Provides functions of reload and resource information gathering to apply changes from IAM Admin.

section.title: User Management
section.para: User Management menu provides overall management menu for users and groups. Click on User List category displays a screen similar to the following.

The menus on left of the screen shows the user group hierarchy structure. Use top button to use fold or unfold functions. And create, modify and delete group functions are available by right click on the tree UI. Click on the group allows to check or modify detail information on the group menu of tab menu on the right.
User list can be checked from Users tab. When a specific group was selected from the left group menu, the users belonging to the group are displayed.
Double clicking on an user from the user list moves to user detail page.

User information can be modified from the detail page. A specific role to an user can be registered or deleted from bottom ROLE LIST screen. Register or delete a role can be done from Roles Management.

section.title: Roles Management
section.para: Roles Management menu manages roles to be registered to an user or resource. Click on the Role List menu displays the tree menu showing hierarchy structure similar as user group menu.

Roles Management menu has 4 tab menus of Role, Resource List, User Group and Users. Each menu is a screen displaying the registered resources, groups or users when a specific role was selected from the role tree on the left.

Resource List page displays the list of resources allocated to the role selected from the left. One cautious thing for allocating a resource to a role is role hierarchy structure. When a resource is allocated to a sub-role, higher role potentially includes the resources of sub-role. So, the higher role has the access authorization for sub-role resources without registering the resources separately.

You can select to display only the resources allocated to current role or all resources allocated to sub-role on the select box on top of resource list screen. (This menu is allowed only to the user using Oracle DB) The following screen is the searched result of all resources allocated to sub-role.

Next menu is User Group tab menu. Selecting the User Group tab menu displays the following screen. This screen performs function of allocating specific roles to all users belonging to the group to improve trouble of registering roles to users individually. The groups in left Multi-select box are the list of groups allocated with roles selected from left role menu.
Advice
Be careful as both of the role and user group have hierarchy relation and can cause confusion. As described in role menu, access to resources registered to sub-role is allowed to higher role user. But don't forget that user group does not operate identically. The higher group does not necessarily has access authority of sub-group in user group menu. The role for the resources must be allocated in order for higher group to have access authority. Make sure to not to use with confusion this function with hierarchy structure of role menu.
Click on Users tab menu displays the following 2 lists. Left menu is the user list having no allocated roles and the right menu is the user list allocated with selected roles.

This menu registers individual user roles, which operates separately with previously described role-group allocation. For example, when ROLE_A is allocated to the GROUP_A where a specific user USER_A belongs to and a different ROLE_B is allocated to the USER_A, the USER_A has access authority for resources of both ROLE_A and ROLE_B. So, when allocating a role to an user or user group, be careful for overlapping resource allocation.

section.title: Resource Management
section.para: Resource Management menu provides a menu to control access to controlling resources. Resource Management menu has 3 detail menus of Resource List, View List and View Mapping.

sect2.title: Resource List
sect2.para: Let's take a look at Resource List menu first. List of currently registered resources can be checked from Resource List menu. URL, Method and PointCut are the 3 types of resource types and registered with each special pattern form. URL resource can be registered as regular expression and POINT CUT can be registered by using the pattern supported from AspectJ. Method type resource is not supporting a specific pattern at the moment. Using the patterns other than regular expression, Method resource pattern application and others are planned to be reviewed on upcoming version.
Below screen is the resource list displayed when the Resource List is selected.

Detail screen for the resource can be checked by double clicking the specific resource. The detail page can enter below resource name, pattern, detail, priority and others. The priority here means the prior matching comparison order between overlapping registered resource patterns. Meaning that matching with higher priority resource first and giving authority.
For example, granting priority of 5 to product/*.do, URL resource type, and 11 to product/add.do, 12 to product/getProduct.do and 13 to product/updateProduct.do resources. The user is planning to grant CRUD (create, read, update, delete) authority of the product to administrator and grant create, read and update authority, but no delete authority to general users. So, the user allocated product/*.do resource to ROLE_ADMIN and product/add.do, product/getProduct.do and product/updateProduct.do resources to ROLE_USER. But when resources were allocated as this can cause the following issues. First, the user allocated as administrator will be able to use all CRUD functions without limits. But, when a general user calls product/getProduct.do URL resource, the product/getProduct.do resource will be compared by matching with resource patterns with priority as the base. So, the product/*.do pattern with higher priority will be matching priorily to compare product/*.do resource allocated ROLE_ADMIN authority and the authority of current user. In the result, the general user access to product/getProduct.do request will be denied as the user does not have ROLE_ADMIN authority,
The followings must be complied in order to not to have errors as above. Advice
Give priority to general resources (ex. *.do) as low as possible (register with larger number).
Setting priority higher to frequently referred resources will improve performance.
For the resources unnecessary to be registered as secured resources, register the corresponding pattern in intercept-url of http namespace tag in Spring Security's default set up file as filters="none".
The following figure is the detail information screen by double clicking a specific resource. You can see that auto complete function is being used when registering resource patterns.
The user basically needs to write resource pattern fields. Auto complete function is supported on resource pattern entry for convenience and prevent mistakes. When the pattern was registered with auto complete function, using regular type and others to register similar name resources in a bundle is not allowed. In such case, clicking the direct entry check box of detail resource pattern field will allow the user to register resource directly. In this case, it is recommended to not to use this method unless the user is a expert on pattern regular expression type as there is a possibility of application malfunction by user mistakes.

Below figure is a screen you can see when you are entering URL type resource patterns. URL pattern is composed with URL Request addess on the left and parameters on the right. You can use parameters selectively as they are not mandatory.

Below 3 figures are screens when entering Method type resource patterns. Method pattern has total of 3 input field and they are package, class and method entry fields from left. As the System Management menu's Resource Gathering gathers and saves enterprise application resources, the patterns can be entered easily by using auto complete function on entering patterns. Writing orders of package information, class and method from the left expresses 3 entries combines form in below detail resource pattern category. The combined information is the pattern form to be saved finally.
Enter package first.
Enter class next.
And enter method for last.
If you cannot remember resource name, enter a space and all resource lists will be displayed. Enter resource patterns with this result will be much easier.

Lastly, let's take a look at entering the POINTCUT type resources. POINTCUT pattern has only one input field and when the user uses auto complete function to write entry field, the below detail resource pattern field completes it to AspectJ support pattern type. If you are an expert on AspectJ supported PointCut type pattern, you can click the Self Input check box and enter detail resource pattern field directly to register numerous patterns as a bundle.

sect2.title: View List
sect2.para: View List menu offers functions to register and modify/delete View Resource for screen control according to the authorization. To control the screen according to authority, use iam:access tag as the followings on the page to surround the contents to control. The screen to register, modify and delete the resources corresponding with viewResourceId in the tag is the View List menu.
Below screen is an example of View List page. Double clicking on a specific View resource allows to move to detail sccreen.
Next is a View resource detail information page. The user needs to enter View Resource ID directly and must pass overlap verification in order to save successfully.

sect2.title: View Mapping
sect2.para: View Mapping menu manages the View resources entered by the user and allocations between user, group and role. Basically, as only the user with the Permission assigned within iam:access by administrator has the authority for tag contents, easy UI is offered to easily manage the Permission from View Mapping screen.

Selecting the View Mapping menu will display the list of users with Permissions to View resources. Reference Type category is the category showing whether the Permission is allocated to an individual user or group or a role. Note that Permission allocated to a user has higher priority than user and user gruop than a role. For example, let's assume the View resource authority for modification of Update Category was given to 'ROLE_ADMIN' role and 'STAFF' group. SATFF group is allocated with 'ROLE_STAFF', lower hierarchy of 'ROLE_ADMIN'. So, the users allocated to 'ROLE_STAFF' other than STAFF group has no authorities for View resource with Update Category ID, but only the STAFF group has authority for the resource. Likewise, even when resources are not allocated to the group, the authority for View resource can be given to an individual user. As this regulation is defined to set exception cases among all the users in a group, it is recommended to create a new role and allocate authority to the role for situation of necessary to give similar authorities to various users in a group.
Below figure is an exmaple screen of allocation list displayed on View Mapping menu selection.

The following figure is an example screen of allocating roles, groups and users to View resources. Enter the View resource ID to be managed on top of the screen and use Add Role, Add Group and Add User buttons to give authority to the subject. Default setting for Permission list is READ, WRITE, CREATE, DELETE, ADMINISTRATION, LIST, PRINT and others as shown on below figure and the user can modify with set up file. See the following Link for user setting change. IAM Core Configuration

section.title: Restriction Management
section.para: Restriction Management offers various menus to manage the resources depending by time. Restricted Times List and Times Mapping menus are the detail menus.

sect2.title: Restricted Times List
sect2.para: Let's take a look at Restricted Times List screen first. Below figure is an example screen displayed by clicking Restricted Times List menu. This screen can register/modify/delete the date and time of resources desired for limitation. Detail categories are Time Type, start/end time, start/end date, description and others. Time Type has 5 categories of improve, daily, weekend, holiday and crash. These mean system improvement, everyday, weekends, holidays and error occurrences respectively. Pay attention when the weekend of Time Type was selected. When set as weekly, users can assume that time control setting can be possible for every weekends between start and end time, but IT DOES NOT. The Time Type category is just a field saving time resources as a text form for easier classification and user must set the start date and end date personally. So, when the user has set the start date to 091001 (Oct. 1, 2009) and end date to 091031 (Oct. 31, 2009) to control authorization for every weekends of October, actual is that the authorization will be controlled for whole October unlike the user's expectation.
Double clicking on a specific time from Time List screen will move to detail screen. Modification to the time resource from detail screen is allowed.

sect2.title: Times Mapping
sect2.para: Next screen is Times Mapping menu. The Times Mapping screen has total of 3 tab menus of Time-Role, Time-Resource and Time-Exclusion.

First, let's take a look at Time-Role menu. The Time-Role menu restricts users with specific roles for a specific time by allocating roles to time resources created from previous Restricted Times List screen. Click on Time-Role menu to see below screen. Below list screen lists the user configured time and allocated roles one by one. Double click on a specific allocation to move to detail screen.

Below screen is a detail information page showing allocation information between time-00001 and ROLE_MANAGER. First, enter the desired time restrict ID by finding from Time ID field and double click on the restriction desired role from below ROLES LIST will display the role list on the right. One thing to be careful here is, if the user has set time restriction for a specific role, the roles under the role also has time restriction. For example, when time was restricted from 000000 to 235959 to ROLE_MANAGER role as below figure for error handling purpose, the users belonging to ROLE_USER and ISAUTHENTICATED_ANONYMOUSLY roles are also restricted from 000000 to 235959.

Next, let's take a look at Time-Resource menu. The Time-Resource menu is to control access authority to a specific resource for a specific time. The list of resources allocated for a specific time can be seen. Double click on a specific Time ID displays the detail screen page to check resource lilsts allocated to the time and descriptions. Below figure is a detail description page of Time-Resource list. To set resource restriction by time, select the desired time's Time ID from top Time ID field first and click below Add Resource button to check the displaying pop-up. Click the desired resource from the pop-up window and Add button displays the resource being allocated on detail screen page.

The menu to look at for last is Time-Exclusion. This menu can set exceptional cases for access restriction depending on time configured from Time-Resource menu. In other words, applying exception case by opening the system exceptionally to a user with administrator authority after blocking access to entire system for error recovery. Click on Time-Exclusion menu displays the list as below figure. Double click on a specific category to move to a detail list page.

Below figure is the detail screen page of Time-Exclusion. To give exclude condition for time restriction, use the search button on the right of top Resource ID field first to check if there is an allocation assigned between Time and Resource. Click the search button displays the existing Time-Resource allocation list, from this, click the resource desired for exclusion. And the following detail categories are completed automatically then open below Role Tree and double click on the role desired for exclusion displays the corresponding role as a list on the right. One thing to be careful here is, the existing roles higher than the role set as exclusion by user also gets access restriction cancelled. For example, when the ROLE_MANAGER role user is set as exclusion from web-000013 resource restriction as below figure, the users belonging to ROLE_ADMIN, the higher users of ROLE_MANAGER, also get restriction cancellations for web-000013 resource. So, keep in mind that the higher roles user of the roles set as exclusion also get restriction cancellation when setting exclusions.

section.title: System Management
section.para: System Management menu offers simple control functions for business application. System Management menu has 2 sub-menus of Resource Reload and Resource Gathering.

sect2.title: Resource Reload
sect2.para: Resource Reload menu offers the functions to apply the settings from 4 previously explained menus. Basically, to apply the changes, the business application server must restart, but using this function allows applying the settings without restarting the server. Click on Resource Reload menu displays the following figure screen.

Select the target application server and choose to reload the information for user/role/resource or reload information of time management menu from Select Box, then clicking the below Reload button will display completion message after a moment of loading.
This action must be performed when the target application server is in operation. Or the following error messages will display.

sect2.title: Resource Gathering
sect2.para: Resource Gathering menu offers functions to gather information of target application. Using this function gathers target application bean setting and Request URL address and others and save temporarily. Saved information provides convenience to users to register resources more easily through auto complete function when registering resources from Resource Managment menu. Click on Resource Gathering menu displays the screen as below figure. Select the application server desired for resource gathering and click on Reload button will display completion message after a moment of loading.
